intro: Anchusa samothracica, commonly known as the Samothrace hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the Greek island of Samothraki. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Anchusa samothracica is often found growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for gardens and botanical collections.
